description.para: Calls the Amazon CodeGuru Reviewer ListRepositoryAssociations API operation.

copyright.para: © Copyright 2012 - 2020 Amazon.com, Inc.or its affiliates.All Rights Reserved.

description.para:
Lists repository associations. You can optionally filter on one or more of the following recommendation properties: provider types, states, names, and owners.
This cmdlet automatically pages all available results to the pipeline - parameters related to iteration are only needed if you want to manually control the paginated output. To disable autopagination, use -NoAutoIteration.
List of repository names to use as a filter.

List of owners to use as a filter. For GitHub, this is name of the GitHub account that was used to associate the repository. For AWS CodeCommit, it is the name of the CodeCommit account that was used to associate the repository.
List of provider types to use as a filter.
List of states to use as a filter.

The maximum number of repository association results returned by ListRepositoryAssociations in paginated output. When this parameter is used, ListRepositoryAssociations only returns maxResults results in a single page with a nextToken response element. The remaining results of the initial request can be seen by sending another ListRepositoryAssociations request with the returned nextToken value. This value can be between 1 and 25. If this parameter is not used, ListRepositoryAssociations returns up to 25 results and a nextToken value if applicable.

The nextToken value returned from a previous paginated ListRepositoryAssociations request where maxResults was used and the results exceeded the value of that parameter. Pagination continues from the end of the previous results that returned the nextToken value. Treat this token as an opaque identifier that is only used to retrieve the next items in a list and not for other programmatic purposes.
Note: This parameter is only used if you are manually controlling output pagination of the service API call.
In order to manually control output pagination, use '-NextToken $null' for the first call and '-NextToken $AWSHistory.LastServiceResponse.NextToken' for subsequent calls.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'RepositoryAssociationSummaries'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.CodeGuruReviewer.Model.ListRepositoryAssociationsResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.CodeGuruReviewer.Model.ListRepositoryAssociationsResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

By default the cmdlet will auto-iterate and retrieve all results to the pipeline by performing multiple service calls. If set, the cmdlet will retrieve only the next 'page' of results using the value of NextToken as the start point.

The maximum number of repository association results returned by ListRepositoryAssociations in paginated output. When this parameter is used, ListRepositoryAssociations only returns maxResults results in a single page with a nextToken response element. The remaining results of the initial request can be seen by sending another ListRepositoryAssociations request with the returned nextToken value. This value can be between 1 and 25. If this parameter is not used, ListRepositoryAssociations returns up to 25 results and a nextToken value if applicable.
List of repository names to use as a filter.

The nextToken value returned from a previous paginated ListRepositoryAssociations request where maxResults was used and the results exceeded the value of that parameter. Pagination continues from the end of the previous results that returned the nextToken value. Treat this token as an opaque identifier that is only used to retrieve the next items in a list and not for other programmatic purposes.
Note: This parameter is only used if you are manually controlling output pagination of the service API call.
In order to manually control output pagination, use '-NextToken $null' for the first call and '-NextToken $AWSHistory.LastServiceResponse.NextToken' for subsequent calls.

By default the cmdlet will auto-iterate and retrieve all results to the pipeline by performing multiple service calls. If set, the cmdlet will retrieve only the next 'page' of results using the value of NextToken as the start point.

List of owners to use as a filter. For GitHub, this is name of the GitHub account that was used to associate the repository. For AWS CodeCommit, it is the name of the CodeCommit account that was used to associate the repository.
List of provider types to use as a filter.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'RepositoryAssociationSummaries'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.CodeGuruReviewer.Model.ListRepositoryAssociationsResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.CodeGuruReviewer.Model.ListRepositoryAssociationsResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.
List of states to use as a filter.

This cmdlet returns a collection of Amazon.CodeGuruReviewer.Model.RepositoryAssociationSummary objects. The service call response (type Amazon.CodeGuruReviewer.Model.ListRepositoryAssociationsResponse) can also be referenced from properties attached to the cmdlet entry in the $AWSHistory stack.
Calls the Amazon CodeGuru Reviewer ListRecommendations API operation.

copyright.para: © Copyright 2012 - 2020 Amazon.com, Inc.or its affiliates.All Rights Reserved.

description.para:
Returns the list of all recommendations for a completed code review.
This cmdlet automatically pages all available results to the pipeline - parameters related to iteration are only needed if you want to manually control the paginated output. To disable autopagination, use -NoAutoIteration.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the code review to describe.
The maximum number of results that are returned per call. The default is 100.

Pagination token.
Note: This parameter is only used if you are manually controlling output pagination of the service API call.
In order to manually control output pagination, use '-NextToken $null' for the first call and '-NextToken $AWSHistory.LastServiceResponse.NextToken' for subsequent calls.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'RecommendationSummaries'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.CodeGuruReviewer.Model.ListRecommendationsResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.CodeGuruReviewer.Model.ListRecommendationsResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the CodeReviewArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^CodeReviewArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

By default the cmdlet will auto-iterate and retrieve all results to the pipeline by performing multiple service calls. If set, the cmdlet will retrieve only the next 'page' of results using the value of NextToken as the start point.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the code review to describe.
The maximum number of results that are returned per call. The default is 100.

Pagination token.
Note: This parameter is only used if you are manually controlling output pagination of the service API call.
In order to manually control output pagination, use '-NextToken $null' for the first call and '-NextToken $AWSHistory.LastServiceResponse.NextToken' for subsequent calls.

By default the cmdlet will auto-iterate and retrieve all results to the pipeline by performing multiple service calls. If set, the cmdlet will retrieve only the next 'page' of results using the value of NextToken as the start point.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the CodeReviewArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^CodeReviewArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'RecommendationSummaries'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.CodeGuruReviewer.Model.ListRecommendationsResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.CodeGuruReviewer.Model.ListRecommendationsResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

This cmdlet returns a collection of Amazon.CodeGuruReviewer.Model.RecommendationSummary objects. The service call response (type Amazon.CodeGuruReviewer.Model.ListRecommendationsResponse) can also be referenced from properties attached to the cmdlet entry in the $AWSHistory stack.

The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) identifying the association. You can retrieve this ARN by calling ListRepositories.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the AssociationArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^AssociationArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'RepositoryAssociation'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.CodeGuruReviewer.Model.DescribeRepositoryAssociationResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.CodeGuruReviewer.Model.DescribeRepositoryAssociationResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

This cmdlet returns an Amazon.CodeGuruReviewer.Model.RepositoryAssociation object. The service call response (type Amazon.CodeGuruReviewer.Model.DescribeRepositoryAssociationResponse) can also be referenced from properties attached to the cmdlet entry in the $AWSHistory stack.
Calls the Amazon CodeGuru Reviewer ListRecommendationFeedback API operation.

copyright.para: © Copyright 2012 - 2020 Amazon.com, Inc.or its affiliates.All Rights Reserved.

description.para:
Lists the customer feedback for a CodeGuru Reviewer recommendation for all users. This API will be used from the console to extract the previously given feedback by the user to pre-populate the feedback emojis for all recommendations.
This cmdlet automatically pages all available results to the pipeline - parameters related to iteration are only needed if you want to manually control the paginated output. To disable autopagination, use -NoAutoIteration.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that identifies the code review.
Filter on recommendationIds that need to be applied before displaying the result. This can be used to query all the recommendation feedback for a given recommendation.
Filter on userIds that need to be applied before displaying the result. This can be used to query all the recommendation feedback for a code review from a given user.
The maximum number of results that are returned per call. The default is 100.

If nextToken is returned, there are more results available. The value of nextToken is a unique pagination token for each page. Make the call again using the returned token to retrieve the next page. Keep all other arguments unchanged.
Note: This parameter is only used if you are manually controlling output pagination of the service API call.
In order to manually control output pagination, use '-NextToken $null' for the first call and '-NextToken $AWSHistory.LastServiceResponse.NextToken' for subsequent calls.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'RecommendationFeedbackSummaries'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.CodeGuruReviewer.Model.ListRecommendationFeedbackResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.CodeGuruReviewer.Model.ListRecommendationFeedbackResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the CodeReviewArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^CodeReviewArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

By default the cmdlet will auto-iterate and retrieve all results to the pipeline by performing multiple service calls. If set, the cmdlet will retrieve only the next 'page' of results using the value of NextToken as the start point.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that identifies the code review.
The maximum number of results that are returned per call. The default is 100.

If nextToken is returned, there are more results available. The value of nextToken is a unique pagination token for each page. Make the call again using the returned token to retrieve the next page. Keep all other arguments unchanged.
Note: This parameter is only used if you are manually controlling output pagination of the service API call.
In order to manually control output pagination, use '-NextToken $null' for the first call and '-NextToken $AWSHistory.LastServiceResponse.NextToken' for subsequent calls.

By default the cmdlet will auto-iterate and retrieve all results to the pipeline by performing multiple service calls. If set, the cmdlet will retrieve only the next 'page' of results using the value of NextToken as the start point.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the CodeReviewArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^CodeReviewArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.
Filter on recommendationIds that need to be applied before displaying the result. This can be used to query all the recommendation feedback for a given recommendation.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'RecommendationFeedbackSummaries'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.CodeGuruReviewer.Model.ListRecommendationFeedbackResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.CodeGuruReviewer.Model.ListRecommendationFeedbackResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.
Filter on userIds that need to be applied before displaying the result. This can be used to query all the recommendation feedback for a code review from a given user.

This cmdlet returns a collection of Amazon.CodeGuruReviewer.Model.RecommendationFeedbackSummary objects. The service call response (type Amazon.CodeGuruReviewer.Model.ListRecommendationFeedbackResponse) can also be referenced from properties attached to the cmdlet entry in the $AWSHistory stack.

description.para: Removes the association between Amazon CodeGuru Reviewer and a repository.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) identifying the association.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'RepositoryAssociation'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.CodeGuruReviewer.Model.DisassociateRepositoryResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.CodeGuruReviewer.Model.DisassociateRepositoryResponse will result in that property being returned. This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) identifying the association.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the AssociationArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^AssociationArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'RepositoryAssociation'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.CodeGuruReviewer.Model.DisassociateRepositoryResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.CodeGuruReviewer.Model.DisassociateRepositoryResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

This cmdlet returns an Amazon.CodeGuruReviewer.Model.RepositoryAssociation object. The service call response (type Amazon.CodeGuruReviewer.Model.DisassociateRepositoryResponse) can also be referenced from properties attached to the cmdlet entry in the $AWSHistory stack.
Calls the Amazon CodeGuru Reviewer AssociateRepository API operation.

copyright.para: © Copyright 2012 - 2020 Amazon.com, Inc.or its affiliates.All Rights Reserved.

description.para: Associates an AWS CodeCommit repository with Amazon CodeGuru Reviewer. When you associate an AWS CodeCommit repository with Amazon CodeGuru Reviewer, Amazon CodeGuru Reviewer will provide recommendations for each pull request raised within the repository. You can view recommendations in the AWS CodeCommit repository. You can associate a GitHub repository using the Amazon CodeGuru Reviewer console.
The name of the AWS CodeCommit repository.

Unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. To add a new repository association, this parameter specifies a unique identifier for the new repository association that helps ensure idempotency. If you use the AWS CLI or one of the AWS SDKs to call this operation, you can leave this parameter empty. The CLI or SDK generates a random UUID for you and includes that in the request. If you don't use the SDK and instead generate a raw HTTP request to the Secrets Manager service endpoint, you must generate a ClientRequestToken yourself for new versions and include that value in the request. You typically interact with this value if you implement your own retry logic and want to ensure that a given repository association is not created twice. We recommend that you generate a UUID-type value to ensure uniqueness within the specified repository association. Amazon CodeGuru Reviewer uses this value to prevent the accidental creation of duplicate repository associations if there are failures and retries.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) identifying the repository connection.
The name of the third party source repository.
The username of the owner of the repository.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'RepositoryAssociation'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.CodeGuruReviewer.Model.AssociateRepositoryResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.CodeGuruReviewer.Model.AssociateRepositoryResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the CodeCommit_Name parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^CodeCommit_Name' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) identifying the repository connection.
The name of the third party source repository.
The username of the owner of the repository.

Unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. To add a new repository association, this parameter specifies a unique identifier for the new repository association that helps ensure idempotency. If you use the AWS CLI or one of the AWS SDKs to call this operation, you can leave this parameter empty. The CLI or SDK generates a random UUID for you and includes that in the request. If you don't use the SDK and instead generate a raw HTTP request to the Secrets Manager service endpoint, you must generate a ClientRequestToken yourself for new versions and include that value in the request. You typically interact with this value if you implement your own retry logic and want to ensure that a given repository association is not created twice. We recommend that you generate a UUID-type value to ensure uniqueness within the specified repository association. Amazon CodeGuru Reviewer uses this value to prevent the accidental creation of duplicate repository associations if there are failures and retries.
The name of the AWS CodeCommit repository.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the CodeCommit_Name parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^CodeCommit_Name' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'RepositoryAssociation'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.CodeGuruReviewer.Model.AssociateRepositoryResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.CodeGuruReviewer.Model.AssociateRepositoryResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

This cmdlet returns an Amazon.CodeGuruReviewer.Model.RepositoryAssociation object. The service call response (type Amazon.CodeGuruReviewer.Model.AssociateRepositoryResponse) can also be referenced from properties attached to the cmdlet entry in the $AWSHistory stack.

Calls the Amazon CodeGuru Reviewer ListCodeReviews API operation.

description.para:
Lists all the code reviews that the customer has created in the past 90 days.
This cmdlet automatically pages all available results to the pipeline - parameters related to iteration are only needed if you want to manually control the paginated output. To disable autopagination, use -NoAutoIteration.
The type of code reviews to list in the response.
List of provider types for filtering that needs to be applied before displaying the result. For example, "providerTypes=[GitHub]" will list code reviews from GitHub.
List of repository names for filtering that needs to be applied before displaying the result.
List of states for filtering that needs to be applied before displaying the result. For example, "states=[Pending]" will list code reviews in the Pending state.
The maximum number of results that are returned per call. The default is 100.

If nextToken is returned, there are more results available. The value of nextToken is a unique pagination token for each page. Make the call again using the returned token to retrieve the next page. Keep all other arguments unchanged.
Note: This parameter is only used if you are manually controlling output pagination of the service API call.
In order to manually control output pagination, use '-NextToken $null' for the first call and '-NextToken $AWSHistory.LastServiceResponse.NextToken' for subsequent calls.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'CodeReviewSummaries'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.CodeGuruReviewer.Model.ListCodeReviewsResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.CodeGuruReviewer.Model.ListCodeReviewsResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.
Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the Type parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^Type' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

By default the cmdlet will auto-iterate and retrieve all results to the pipeline by performing multiple service calls. If set, the cmdlet will retrieve only the next 'page' of results using the value of NextToken as the start point.
The maximum number of results that are returned per call. The default is 100.

If nextToken is returned, there are more results available. The value of nextToken is a unique pagination token for each page. Make the call again using the returned token to retrieve the next page. Keep all other arguments unchanged.
Note: This parameter is only used if you are manually controlling output pagination of the service API call.
In order to manually control output pagination, use '-NextToken $null' for the first call and '-NextToken $AWSHistory.LastServiceResponse.NextToken' for subsequent calls.

By default the cmdlet will auto-iterate and retrieve all results to the pipeline by performing multiple service calls. If set, the cmdlet will retrieve only the next 'page' of results using the value of NextToken as the start point.
Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the Type parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^Type' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.
List of provider types for filtering that needs to be applied before displaying the result. For example, "providerTypes=[GitHub]" will list code reviews from GitHub.
List of repository names for filtering that needs to be applied before displaying the result.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'CodeReviewSummaries'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.CodeGuruReviewer.Model.ListCodeReviewsResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.CodeGuruReviewer.Model.ListCodeReviewsResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.
List of states for filtering that needs to be applied before displaying the result. For example, "states=[Pending]" will list code reviews in the Pending state.
The type of code reviews to list in the response.

This cmdlet returns a collection of Amazon.CodeGuruReviewer.Model.CodeReviewSummary objects. The service call response (type Amazon.CodeGuruReviewer.Model.ListCodeReviewsResponse) can also be referenced from properties attached to the cmdlet entry in the $AWSHistory stack.

description.para: Describes the customer feedback for a CodeGuru Reviewer recommendation.
The recommendation ID that can be used to track the provided recommendations and then to collect the feedback.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that identifies the code review.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'RecommendationFeedback'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.CodeGuruReviewer.Model.DescribeRecommendationFeedbackResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.CodeGuruReviewer.Model.DescribeRecommendationFeedbackResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

copyright.para: © Copyright 2012 - 2020 Amazon.com, Inc.or its affiliates.All Rights Reserved.

description.para: Stores customer feedback for a CodeGuru-Reviewer recommendation. When this API is called again with different reactions the previous feedback is overwritten.
The recommendation ID that can be used to track the provided recommendations and then to collect the feedback.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that identifies the code review.
List for storing reactions. Reactions are utf-8 text code for emojis. If you send an empty list it clears all your feedback.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.CodeGuruReviewer.Model.PutRecommendationFeedbackResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the RecommendationId parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^RecommendationId' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that identifies the code review.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the RecommendationId parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^RecommendationId' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.
List for storing reactions. Reactions are utf-8 text code for emojis. If you send an empty list it clears all your feedback.
The recommendation ID that can be used to track the provided recommendations and then to collect the feedback.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.CodeGuruReviewer.Model.PutRecommendationFeedbackResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

This cmdlet does not generate any output.The service response (type Amazon.CodeGuruReviewer.Model.PutRecommendationFeedbackResponse) can be referenced from properties attached to the cmdlet entry in the $AWSHistory stack.
